[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: AddNFTType()] [State Iteration DOS] Line 142 adds to State.NFTTypes.Value dictionary - can excessive additions make InitialNFTTypeNameMap iterations prohibitively expensive? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [TotalSupply Overflow] input.TotalSupply at line 31 is int64 without bounds checking - can MAX_INT64 value cause overflows in minting operations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: CrossChainCreate()] [TotalSupply Manipulation] tokenInfo.TotalSupply at line 98 from external contract - can negative or overflow values corrupt protocol supply tracking? (High)
[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [ChainId Overflow] input.IssueChainId at line 29 is int32 - can overflow/negative values cause cross-chain issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Event Data Injection] NFTProtocolCreated event at lines 55-67 includes user-controlled data - can malicious values in event fields exploit off-chain listeners? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: CrossChainCreate()] [Event Data Forgery] NFTProtocolCreated at lines 115-127 trusts tokenInfo data - can malicious mainchain token emit misleading events on sidechain? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: AddNFTType()] [Event Missing Data] NFTTypeAdded event at lines 144-148 only includes ShortName and FullName - can missing context make event tracking unreliable? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Symbol Return Race] Symbol is returned at line 71 but state is set earlier - can caller receive symbol for protocol that failed to fully initialize? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Decimals Hardcoded] Line 26 hardcodes Decimals = 0 - is this enforced elsewhere, or can TokenContract be called directly with non-zero decimals to break NFT invariant? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Creator vs Sender Confusion] Lines 22 and 27 allow input.Creator to differ from Context.Sender - can this cause confusion in ownership tracking or authorization? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_Create.cs] [Function: Create()] [Issuer Permission Scope] TokenContract issuer at line 27 may have different permissions than NFT minters - can this cause permission mismatches in mint operations? (Medium)
